title.justification: It captures the scope and tool discussed in the paper.

extractions.description: The paper introduces TGX, a Python package specially designed for the analysis of temporal networks, with capabilities encompassing data loading, data processing, and detailed analysis of evolving graphs.

type.justification: The paper presents a new tool (TGX), discusses its features, and demonstrates its application using existing datasets.
type.quote: Bridging this gap, we introduce TGX, a Python package specially designed for analysis of temporal networks.

name.justification: The main focus is on temporal graph analysis, which is a subset of graph neural networks.
name.quote: Real-world networks, with their evolving relations, are best captured as temporal graphs.

name.justification: The paper specifically handles temporal graphs and their analysis.
name.quote: However, existing software libraries are largely designed for static graphs where the dynamic nature of temporal graphs is ignored.

name.justification: Network analysis is a key functionality of the TGX package described in the paper.
name.quote: TGX offers network analysis by providing a diverse set of measures, including average node degree and the evolving number of nodes and edges per timestamp.

name.justification: The paper explicitly mentions the MOOC dataset as an example of a built-in dataset in TGX.
name.quote: As an example, the command tgx.builtin.mooc.

referenced_paper_title.value: Towards better evaluation for dynamic link prediction
referenced_paper_title.justification: This paper is referenced in connection with the built-in datasets in TGX, including the MOOC dataset.
referenced_paper_title.quote: TGX offers access to eleven built-in datasets from [6].

name.justification: The paper references PyTorch Geometric as a commonly used package for training and benchmarking graph learning models.
name.quote: There are also commonly used packages for training and benchmarking different graph learning models such as PyTorch Geometric [2].

referenced_paper_title.value: Fast graph representation learning with PyTorch Geometric
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference [2] for PyTorch Geometric points to this paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: There are also commonly used packages for training and benchmarking different graph learning models such as PyTorch Geometric [2].

name.justification: The paper references DGL as a commonly used package for training and benchmarking graph learning models.
name.quote: There are also commonly used packages for training and benchmarking different graph learning models such as... DGL [10]

referenced_paper_title.value: Deep graph library: A graph-centric, highly-performant package for graph neural networks
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference [10] for DGL points to this paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: There are also commonly used packages for training and benchmarking different graph learning models such as... DGL [10].

name.justification: The paper explains that NetworkX is extensively used for visualization and the study of graph patterns.
name.quote: The main library currently used for visualization and study of patterns of graphs is Networkx [3].

referenced_paper_title.value: Exploring Network Structure, Dynamics, and Function using NetworkX
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference [3] for NetworkX points to this paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The main library currently used for visualization and study of patterns of graphs is Networkx [3].

name.justification: The paper references StellarGraph as a commonly used package for training and benchmarking graph learning models.
name.quote: There are also commonly used packages for training and benchmarking different graph learning models such as... StellarGraph [1].
